sections.purpose: To provide automated and standardized cleaning of laboratory glassware.
sections.scope: Applicable to cleaning procedures in Pharmaceutical Chemistry.
procedure: Remove any solid residues or hazardous chemicals from glassware manually first.
Load the glassware into the washer racks, ensuring openings face downwards.
Check the detergent and rinse aid levels in the dispensers.
Select the appropriate wash cycle based on the level of contamination.
Start the wash cycle and monitor for any leakages.
Wait for the completion of the drying cycle before opening the door.
Unload the glassware and inspect for cleanliness and water spots.
Clean the washer filter after every 5-10 cycles.
precautions: Use only laboratory-grade detergents specifically designed for washers.
Do not load broken or severely chipped glassware.
Ensure the spray arms can rotate freely after loading the racks.
Wear gloves when handling glassware that has undergone a caustic wash.
Maintain the water softening system as per manufacturer instructions.
